Events that occurred on 18 August

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1945 - Eric Rücker Eddison dies.
1954 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 148a.
1973 - Mythcon 4 in Santa Barbara, California.
1975 - Mythcon 6 at Scripps College in Claremont, California.
1992 - Tolkien Centenary Conference, a combination of Oxonmoot 1992 and Mythcon 23, at Keble College, Oxford.
1997 - The audiobook Pearl and Sir Orfeo by J.R.R. Tolkien, read by Terry Jones, is published.
2000 - Mythcon 31 in Hawaii.
2008 - Mythcon 39 at Central Connecticut State University in New Britain, Connecticut.
2012 - The Return of the Ring, Tolkien Society conference at Loughborough University, England.
2023 - Game developer Wendell Lariston Hill, Jr. dies.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
A riding of Elessar, Gandalf, Celeborn, Galadriel, the Hobbits, and many more, make camp at Helm's Deep.[1]

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix B, "The Chief Days from the Fall of Barad-dûr to the End of the Third Age"
